translations: adj.无节制的，过度的；不适中的

sentences.sentence: He launched an immoderate tirade on Turner.
sentences.translation: 他对特纳发表了一篇过激的演说。

sentences.sentence: Dinah would contract such an immoderate attachment to her scoured tin.
sentences.translation: 黛娜对于那些擦得亮晶晶的锡器会忽然倍加宠爱起来。

sentences.sentence: His successor, Ben Bernanke, did best to allay fears of an immoderate slowdown.
sentences.translation: 而他的继任者本·伯南克则竭尽全力缓和经济衰退的预期所带来的紧张气氛。
